bt.net

Interface PeerConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface PeerConnection
extends Closeable
    Connection with a remote peer.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      Close the connection without throwing an IOException.

    • Method Detail

      • getRemotePeer

        Peer getRemotePeer()
        Returns:
        Remote peer
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTorrentId

        TorrentId getTorrentId()
        Returns:
        ID of a torrent, that this peer is interested in sharing or downloading
        Since:
        1.0

      • readMessageNow

        Message readMessageNow()
        Attempt to read an incoming message. Note that implementation may buffer all received data and try to read next message from the buffer, so calling this method does not necessarily imply I/O access.
        Returns:
        Message, or null if there isn't any
        Since:
        1.0

      • readMessage

        Message readMessage(long timeout)
        Attempt to read an incoming message within a specified time interval. Invocation blocks the calling thread until either a message is read or the limit of waiting time is reached. Note that implementation may buffer all received data and try to read next message from the buffer, so calling this method does not necessarily imply I/O access.
        Returns:
        Message, or null if there isn't any
        Since:
        1.0

      • postMessage

        void postMessage(Message message)
        Send a message to remote peer.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getLastActive

        long getLastActive()
        Returns:
        Last time a message was received or sent via this connection
        Since:
        1.0

      • closeQuietly

        void closeQuietly()
        Close the connection without throwing an IOException.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true if connection is closed
        Since:
        1.0
